title: Bankruptcy; Will SBA loans from old biz discharge? Can they garnish Social Security income? Would need to sue to get judgment?
question: I am just wondering if a SBA loan would need to sue me b4 attaching to my home, etc. Also, can they go after my Social security proceeds. Bankruptcy take care of everything?
question_tags: Child support,Alimony,Bankruptcy,Debt,Child support lien,Lien,Nondischargeable debt and alimony,Unsecured debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Property title report,Real estate and bankruptcy,Real estate,Child support and social security benefits,Social security
answers:
SBA Loans are dischargeable. Creditors cannot go after social security income. That income is exempt from garnishment.
Bankruptcy would take care of all your unsecured debt as long as you qualify and don't have much equity or large assets. Make sure to speak with an attorney to go over your situation specifically.

SBA loans are generally treated like any other loan.

Rob

SBA usually puts a lien on all your real estate at the time you take out the loan to secure the debt. You should run a title report on the property ASAP to see if they did. I had one client where the didn't so you may luck out.

SBA loans are dischargable. No garnishment of Social Security. Bankruptcy, if you qualify, will take care of it. No worries.

Most of us Bankruptcy attorneys offer free consultations. You should take advantage of that.

Your SBA loan can discharge through bankruptcy, but in many instances, the SBA has taken a security interest in everything you own, form your house, to your car, to your wedding rings and if you don't pay the SBA, they can take anything you have given them as collateral for the loan. Social security benefits are protected from most creditors by federal law, the primary exceptions are for child support, alimony and tax debts. SBA is not allowed to take social security benefits without your consent. Hope this perspective helps!

You SS cannot be touched by any creditor.

I hope my answer is helpful.
